{'name': 'state', 'in': 'query', 'description': "Retrieves links in the specified state(s). Possible states are:
 - `created`: The payout link has been created, but the amount has not yet been [blocked](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/transfers/payout-links#sender-link-generation).
 - `failed`: The payout link couldn't be generated due to a failure during transaction booking.
- `awaiting`: The payout link is awaiting approval.
 - `active`: The payout link can be redeemed.
- `expired`: The payout link cannot be redeemed because it wasn't claimed before its expiry date.
- `cancelled`: The payout link cannot be redeemed because it was cancelled.
 - `processing`: The payout link has been redeemed and is being processed.
 - `processed`: The payout link has been redeemed and the money has been transferred to the recipient.

Use for filtering to retrieve only links in specified states.
To specify multiple values, follow this pattern: `state={VALUE1}&state={VALUE2}`.", 'schema': {'type': 'array', 'items': {'$ref': '#/components/schemas/PayoutLinkState'}}, 'explode': True, 'uniqueItems': True} is not valid under any of the given schemas

{'name': 'created_before', 'in': 'query', 'description': 'Retrieves events with `created_at` < `created_before`. 
Cannot be older than the current date minus 21 days. 
The default value is the current date and time at which you are calling the endpoint.

Provided in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.', 'schema': {'type': 'string', 'format': 'date-time or date', 'minimum': "'created_at' - 21 days", 'default': 'the date-time at which the request is made'}} is not valid under any of the given schemas

If `false` then the counterparty will not show up on your counterparties list, for example, when you retrieve your counterparties.

data.current_summary: Retrieve a list of failed webhook events
data.current_description:
Get the list of all your failed webhook events, or use the query parameters to filter the results.

The events are sorted by the `created_at` date in reverse chronological order.

The returned failed events are **paginated**. 
The maximum number of events returned per page is specified by the `limit` parameter.
To get to the next page, make a new request and use the `created_at` date of the last event returned in the previous response.

For more information, see the guides: [About webhooks](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/webhooks/about-webhooks) and [Manage webhooks](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/webhooks/manage-webhooks#retrieve-a-list-of-failed-webhook-events).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of failed webhook events for the specified webhook. Events are sorted by `created_at` in reverse chronological order (newest first). Use query parameters to filter results by date range or other criteria. The response includes failed event details with pagination metadata. To retrieve subsequent pages, use the `created_at` timestamp of the last event from the previous response as the cursor. Each page returns a maximum number of events specified by the `limit` parameter.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks clarity on input parameters (what filters are available, what the webhook_id represents) and output details (what fields are returned, pagination metadata structure). The description also doesn't clearly explain how to use the cursor-based pagination mechanism. The improved description specifies that results are paginated, clarifies the sorting order, explains the cursor-based pagination approach, and indicates that query parameters enable filtering. This helps AI agents understand the operation's pagination behavior and filtering capabilities.

data.current_description:
Get the sell exchange rate between two currencies.

For more information, see the guides: [Exchange money](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/exchange-money).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the exchange rate between two currencies for a specified amount. Accepts source currency, target currency, and amount as parameters. Returns the sell exchange rate and the equivalent amount in the target currency. Use this to determine conversion rates before executing an exchange or payment involving foreign currency.
data.reasoning: Current description is too brief and lacks clarity about inputs and outputs. It mentions 'sell exchange rate' but doesn't explain what parameters are required (source currency, target currency, amount) or what the response contains. AI agents need to understand what data to provide and what to expect in return.

message: Operation 'getExchangeReasons' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Get exchange reasons' is vague and doesn't convey the actionable purpose. Improved summary clarifies that this retrieves reason codes needed for compliance. Description is otherwise comprehensive, explaining the conditional requirement, the purpose, and how to use the results downstream.

data.current_description:
Depending on the country and the amount of funds to be exchanged, you might be required to provide an exchange reason. 
With this endpoint, you can retrieve all exchange reasons available to your business account.
 
After you retrieve the results, use the appropriate reason code in the `exchange_reason_code` field when [exchanging money](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/business/exchange-money) or [making a payment](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/business/create-payment) that involves foreign currency exchange.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve available exchange reason codes

data.current_description:
Create a new counterparty to transact with.
Test accounts for Sandbox In the Sandbox environment, you cannot add real people and businesses as Revolut counterparties. To help you simulate [Create a counterparty](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/business/add-counterparty) requests for counterparties of profile type `personal`, we created some test accounts. Look inside for test Revtags. To add a counterparty via Revtag, use one of these pairs for the `name` and `revtag` fields respectively: - `Test User 1` & `john1pvki` - `Test User 2` & `john2pvki` - ... - `Test User 9` & `john9pvki`

For more information, see the guides: [Create a counterparty](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/counterparties/create-a-counterparty).
data.description_suggestion: Create a new counterparty to enable transactions with individuals or businesses. Accepts counterparty details including name, banking information, and profile type (personal or business). Returns the created counterparty object with a unique ID. In Sandbox, use test Revtags (john1pvki through john9pvki) with corresponding test names for personal profile counterparties. Freelancer accounts require manual 2FA approval before making transfers to newly created counterparties.

data.current_summary: Create a transfer to another account or card
data.current_description:
Make a payment to a counterparty. You can choose either a bank transfer or a card transfer. The resulting transaction has the type `transfer`.
 
If you make the payment to another Revolut account, either business or personal, the transaction is executed instantly.

If the counterparty has multiple payment methods available, for example, 2 accounts, or 1 account and 1 card, you **must specify the account or card** to which you want to transfer the money (`receiver.account_id` or `receiver.card_id` respectively) .

:::caution
 Due to PSD2 Strong Customer Authentication regulations, the `/pay` endpoint is only available for customers on Revolut Business Company plans.
If you're a freelancer and wish to make payments via our API, we advise that you instead leverage our Payment drafts ([`/payment-drafts`](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/business/create-payment-draft)) endpoint.
:::

For more details, see the guides: [Send money via bank transfer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/transfers/bank-transfers) and [Card transfers](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/transfers/card-transfers).
data.summary_suggestion: Create a payment to a counterparty account or card
data.description_suggestion: Make a payment to a counterparty via bank transfer or card transfer. Returns a transaction object with type `transfer`. Payments to other Revolut accounts execute instantly. If the counterparty has multiple payment methods, you must specify the target account or card using `receiver.account_id` or `receiver.card_id`. Note: This endpoint is only available for Revolut Business Company plans; Freelancer accounts should use the Payment drafts endpoint instead due to PSD2 Strong Customer Authentication requirements.

message: Semantic analysis completed: 43 operations analyzed, 24 quality issues found

{'name': 'state', 'in': 'query', 'description': "Retrieves links in the specified state(s). Possible states are:
 - `created`: The payout link has been created, but the amount has not yet been [blocked](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/transfers/payout-links#sender-link-generation).
 - `failed`: The payout link couldn't be generated due to a failure during transaction booking.
- `awaiting`: The payout link is awaiting approval.
 - `active`: The payout link can be redeemed.
- `expired`: The payout link cannot be redeemed because it wasn't claimed before its expiry date.
- `cancelled`: The payout link cannot be redeemed because it was cancelled.
 - `processing`: The payout link has been redeemed and is being processed.

Operation 'getFailedWebhookEvents' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. The current description explains pagination mechanics well but lacks clarity on: (1) what constitutes a 'failed' webhook event and why it matters for AI agents, (2) explicit mention of required `webhook_id` path parameter, (3) what specific query parameters are available for filtering, and (4) what the response structure contains. The improved description adds context about what failed events represent, clarifies the pagination cursor mechanism, and better explains the operational purpose for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_summary: Retrieve a list of failed webhook events
data.current_description:
Get the list of all your failed webhook events, or use the query parameters to filter the results.

The events are sorted by the `created_at` date in reverse chronological order.

The returned failed events are **paginated**. 
The maximum number of events returned per page is specified by the `limit` parameter.
To get to the next page, make a new request and use the `created_at` date of the last event returned in the previous response.

For more information, see the guides: [About webhooks](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/webhooks/about-webhooks) and [Manage webhooks](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/webhooks/manage-webhooks#retrieve-a-list-of-failed-webhook-events).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of failed webhook events for the specified webhook. Events are sorted by `created_at` in reverse chronological order. Supports filtering via query parameters. Returns a paginated response with a maximum of `limit` events per page. To retrieve subsequent pages, use the `created_at` timestamp of the last event from the previous response as the cursor. Failed events indicate webhook delivery attempts that did not receive a successful HTTP response.
data.reasoning: The current description explains pagination mechanics well but lacks clarity on: (1) what constitutes a 'failed' webhook event and why it matters for AI agents, (2) explicit mention of required `webhook_id` path parameter, (3) what specific query parameters are available for filtering, and (4) what the response structure contains. The improved description adds context about what failed events represent, clarifies the pagination cursor mechanism, and better explains the operational purpose for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'getRate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Current description is too brief and lacks clarity about inputs and outputs. It mentions 'sell exchange rate' but doesn't explain what parameters are required (source currency, target currency, amount) or what the response contains. AI agents need to understand the input requirements and response structure to use this operation effectively.

data.current_description:
Get the sell exchange rate between two currencies.

For more information, see the guides: [Exchange money](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/exchange-money).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the exchange rate between two currencies for a specified amount. Accepts source currency, target currency, and amount as parameters. Returns the sell exchange rate and the converted amount. Use this to determine exchange rates before executing a currency exchange transaction.
data.reasoning: Current description is too brief and lacks clarity about inputs and outputs. It mentions 'sell exchange rate' but doesn't explain what parameters are required (source currency, target currency, amount) or what the response contains. AI agents need to understand the input requirements and response structure to use this operation effectively.

message: Operation 'getExchangeReasons' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary is too generic. 'Get exchange reasons' doesn't clearly convey that this retrieves reason codes required for regulatory compliance. Improved summary clarifies the actionable output (reason codes) and the purpose (availability for use in other operations). Description is otherwise comprehensive and contextual.

data.current_description:
Depending on the country and the amount of funds to be exchanged, you might be required to provide an exchange reason. 
With this endpoint, you can retrieve all exchange reasons available to your business account.
 
After you retrieve the results, use the appropriate reason code in the `exchange_reason_code` field when [exchanging money](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/business/exchange-money) or [making a payment](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/business/create-payment) that involves foreign currency exchange.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve available exchange reason codes
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic. 'Get exchange reasons' doesn't clearly convey that this retrieves reason codes required for regulatory compliance. Improved summary clarifies the actionable output (reason codes) and the purpose (availability for use in other operations). Description is otherwise comprehensive and contextual.

message: Operation 'deleteWebhookV1' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, inconsistent_terminology. The current summary is generic. The description lacks context about deprecation status and doesn't clarify the side effect (stopping notifications). Added clarity about v1 deprecation, authentication requirement, and response behavior to help AI agents understand this is a legacy operation.

data.current_description: Delete a webhook so that events are not sent to the specified URL any more.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete webhook and stop event notifications

For example, after you make a transfer in Sandbox, you can change its state to `completed`. The resulting state is final and cannot be changed.

For more information, see the guides: [Test your flows with simulations (Sandbox only)](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/api-usage-and-testing/test-flows-with-simulations).

data.current_description:
Create a new counterparty to transact with.
Test accounts for Sandbox In the Sandbox environment, you cannot add real people and businesses as Revolut counterparties. To help you simulate [Create a counterparty](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/business/add-counterparty) requests for counterparties of profile type `personal`, we created some test accounts. Look inside for test Revtags. To add a counterparty via Revtag, use one of these pairs for the `name` and `revtag` fields respectively: - `Test User 1` & `john1pvki` - `Test User 2` & `john2pvki` - ... - `Test User 9` & `john9pvki`

For more information, see the guides: [Create a counterparty](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/counterparties/create-a-counterparty).
data.description_suggestion: Create a new counterparty (individual or business) to enable transactions. Accepts counterparty details such as name, banking information, and profile type. Returns the created counterparty object with a unique ID. In Sandbox, use test Revtags (john1pvki through john9pvki) for personal profile counterparties. Note: Freelancer accounts may require manual 2FA approval before making transfers to newly created counterparties.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description lacks clarity about what inputs are expected (counterparty details, profile type) and what is returned (counterparty object with ID). data.current_summary: Create a transfer to another account or card
data.current_description:
Make a payment to a counterparty. You can choose either a bank transfer or a card transfer. The resulting transaction has the type `transfer`.
 
If you make the payment to another Revolut account, either business or personal, the transaction is executed instantly.

If the counterparty has multiple payment methods available, for example, 2 accounts, or 1 account and 1 card, you **must specify the account or card** to which you want to transfer the money (`receiver.account_id` or `receiver.card_id` respectively) .

:::caution
 Due to PSD2 Strong Customer Authentication regulations, the `/pay` endpoint is only available for customers on Revolut Business Company plans.
If you're a freelancer and wish to make payments via our API, we advise that you instead leverage our Payment drafts ([`/payment-drafts`](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/business/create-payment-draft)) endpoint.
:::

For more details, see the guides: [Send money via bank transfer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/transfers/bank-transfers) and [Card transfers](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/transfers/card-transfers).
data.summary_suggestion: Create a payment to a counterparty account or card
data.description_suggestion: Make a payment to a counterparty via bank transfer or card transfer. The resulting transaction has the type `transfer`. If the counterparty has multiple payment methods available, you must specify the target account or card using `receiver.account_id` or `receiver.card_id`. Payments to other Revolut accounts execute instantly. Returns the created transaction object with its ID and status. Note: This endpoint is only available for Revolut Business Company plans; freelancers should use the Payment drafts endpoint instead due to PSD2 Strong Customer Authentication regulations.

data.summary_suggestion: Configure webhook URL for event notifications
data.description_suggestion: Configure a webhook URL to receive event notifications for your business account. Requires an HTTPS URL endpoint. Supported events include TransactionCreated and TransactionStateChanged. When configured, Revolut will POST event notifications to the specified URL. If the receiver returns an HTTP error response, Revolut will retry the webhook event two more times. Returns the webhook configuration object with the registered URL and event subscription details. This operation replaces any previously configured webhook.

Operation 'getFailedWebhookEvents' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. The current description explains pagination mechanics well but lacks clarity on: (1) what constitutes a 'failed' webhook event and why it matters for AI agents, (2) explicit mention of required `webhook_id` path parameter, (3) what specific query parameters are available for filtering, and (4) what the response structure contains. The improved description adds context about what failed events represent, clarifies the pagination cursor mechanism, and better explains the operational purpose for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_summary: Retrieve a list of failed webhook events
data.current_description:
Get the list of all your failed webhook events, or use the query parameters to filter the results.

The events are sorted by the `created_at` date in reverse chronological order.

The returned failed events are **paginated**. 
The maximum number of events returned per page is specified by the `limit` parameter.
To get to the next page, make a new request and use the `created_at` date of the last event returned in the previous response.

For more information, see the guides: [About webhooks](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/webhooks/about-webhooks) and [Manage webhooks](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/webhooks/manage-webhooks#retrieve-a-list-of-failed-webhook-events).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of failed webhook events for the specified webhook. Events are sorted by `created_at` in reverse chronological order. Supports filtering via query parameters. Returns a paginated response with a maximum of `limit` events per page. To retrieve subsequent pages, use the `created_at` timestamp of the last event from the previous response as the cursor. Failed events indicate webhook delivery attempts that did not receive a successful HTTP response.
data.reasoning: The current description explains pagination mechanics well but lacks clarity on: (1) what constitutes a 'failed' webhook event and why it matters for AI agents, (2) explicit mention of required `webhook_id` path parameter, (3) what specific query parameters are available for filtering, and (4) what the response structure contains. The improved description adds context about what failed events represent, clarifies the pagination cursor mechanism, and better explains the operational purpose for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'getExchangeReasons' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary is too generic. 'Get exchange reasons' doesn't clearly convey that this retrieves reason codes required for regulatory compliance. Improved summary clarifies the actionable output (reason codes) and the purpose (availability for use in other operations). Description is otherwise comprehensive and contextual.

data.current_description:
Depending on the country and the amount of funds to be exchanged, you might be required to provide an exchange reason. 
With this endpoint, you can retrieve all exchange reasons available to your business account.
 
After you retrieve the results, use the appropriate reason code in the `exchange_reason_code` field when [exchanging money](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/business/exchange-money) or [making a payment](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/business/create-payment) that involves foreign currency exchange.

For more information, see the guides: [About webhooks](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/webhooks/about-webhooks) and [Manage webhooks](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/webhooks/manage-webhooks#rotate-a-webhook-signing-secret).
data.description_suggestion: Rotate the signing secret for a specific webhook to enhance security. This operation generates a new signing secret for webhook request verification. The new secret is returned in the response and should be updated in your webhook consumer to validate incoming webhook signatures. The previous secret becomes invalid after rotation.

data.current_summary: Simulate a transfer state update (Sandbox only)
data.current_description:
Simulate a transfer state change in the Sandbox environment. 
 
For example, after you make a transfer in Sandbox, you can change its state to `completed`. The resulting state is final and cannot be changed.

For more information, see the guides: [Test your flows with simulations (Sandbox only)](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/api-usage-and-testing/test-flows-with-simulations).
data.description_suggestion: Simulate a transfer state change in the Sandbox environment by providing the transaction ID and desired action. Supported actions include transitioning a transfer to `completed` or other valid terminal states. The resulting state is final and cannot be changed. Returns the updated transaction object with the new state. Sandbox-only feature for testing payment workflows.

data.current_summary: Create a transfer to another account or card
data.current_description:
Make a payment to a counterparty. You can choose either a bank transfer or a card transfer. The resulting transaction has the type `transfer`.
 
If you make the payment to another Revolut account, either business or personal, the transaction is executed instantly.

If the counterparty has multiple payment methods available, for example, 2 accounts, or 1 account and 1 card, you **must specify the account or card** to which you want to transfer the money (`receiver.account_id` or `receiver.card_id` respectively) .

:::caution
 Due to PSD2 Strong Customer Authentication regulations, the `/pay` endpoint is only available for customers on Revolut Business Company plans.
If you're a freelancer and wish to make payments via our API, we advise that you instead leverage our Payment drafts ([`/payment-drafts`](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/business/create-payment-draft)) endpoint.
:::

For more details, see the guides: [Send money via bank transfer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/transfers/bank-transfers) and [Card transfers](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/manage-accounts/transfers/card-transfers).

If the counterparty has multiple payment methods available, you must specify the target account or card using `receiver.account_id` or `receiver.card_id`. Payments to other Revolut accounts execute instantly. Returns the created transaction object with its ID and status. Note: This endpoint is only available for Revolut Business Company plans; freelancers must use the Payment drafts endpoint instead due to PSD2 Strong Customer Authentication regulations.
